item.title: Four words
item.description: Four words © Joel Aguilozi, 2020 On the surface of the sea, four words sailed aimlessly; their names: Wind, Fire, Rock and Water. Agua didn’t mind sailing aimlessly, in fact, he loved it! On the other hand, Fire, despite being contained in a bottle and lit on a small piece of paper, was agonizing with fear due to the proximity of Water; and even when his pain was atrocious, Wind tried to save him as best he could every time the poor thing seemed to be extinguished.

item.title: Life's little things
item.description: Life’s little things © Joel Aguilozi, 2020 Tell the story… no, it started badly, like it did a few years ago when I started writing, it definitely started badly, badly, like Edward Venit the day his life changed forever. One day, Edward went to sleep, upset at his lack of luck; So much so that he earned the nickname “yeta Venit”. That day Edward invoked whoever would listen to him from beyond, from another galaxy, or who knows where, to free him from his bad luck…And he was heard; Edward transformed himself, just as Gregorio Samsa did, into an insect; the good luck insect!

item.title: Love is not a crime
item.description: Love is not a crime © Joel Aguilozi, 2020 I woke up to the gray light of dawn; I had spent a quiet, dreamless night, and I felt like a new man. However, my concerns remained the same as always, the hours of rest did not change anything. I looked out the window. Iván, in his underwear, shook the carpet in the middle of the park. He greeted me cordially like every day; I asked him why he shook the carpet so hard, “I washed it yesterday” I told him; I smiled and thought “his obsession hasn’t changed since I met him, he always wants to have everything in order, maybe that’s what sparked part of my love for him”, I still remember the day when I told my father that I had fallen in love… And How can I not remember him, if that was the last day I spent in my house, the last day he spoke to me.

item.title: Mark's Mission
item.description: Mark’s Mission © Joel Aguilozi, 2020 Mark bought his first house with the money he saved from his job on cruise ships. He spoke fluently Spanish, German, French and even a little Russian and of course English, his native language. He had been away from England for three months and the month of November was already entering. They had crossed the Atlantic to Barbados and I was looking forward to return to your new home.

item.title: Remind yourself
item.description: Remind yourself © Joel Aguilozi, 2020 What is immortality? And why do many desire it so fervently? I sat down and I would have liked to have a cup of tea, because I need some time to tell you my story, they told me It tastes “very delicious” it’s a shame but I never could nor will I be able to taste it. Have you ever imagined a world without feelings?

item.title: Silver for Rest
item.description: Silver for Rest © Joel Aguilozi, 2020 Helsinki, 1920. Jukka and Kalevi were looking for the town doctor, a man named Eikki. The work had to be quick and easy. The pay was good. With the rifle with silver bullets behind them, they arrived at the doctor’s house when the sun was just rising. They knocked on the door without caring if the man was still sleeping. He opened it, and upon seeing them, he suspected who they were (in small towns there are things that are impossible to hide).

item.title: The beginning
item.description: The beginning © Joel Aguilozi, 2020 For a while I decide to leave everything as it is; I need to assimilate these changes. I don’t move, I just wait for the moment!… Wait a minute… I don’t know what to expect! I am recovering my original form. Something creaks and creaks again. From time to time I shudder. There is a part of me that seems to cry; However, I feel fine, although a little dazed.

item.title: The essential is invisible to the eyes
item.description: The essential is invisible to the eyes © Joel Aguilozi, 2020 Outside, the sun was shining brightly, for everyone except Adrian. His case was extremely rare; He was almost blind during the day, but not at night. And he wasn’t albino. Until now, no other person in the world was known to suffer from this very rare disease, so since they noticed this anomaly when he was just a child, they nicknamed him “the dark child.

item.title: The Last Consolation
item.description: The Last Consolation © Joel Aguilozi, 2020 I was running in a forest. He didn’t distinguish colors. Everything looked black and white. Someone was chasing me. I just ran, ran, ran. I felt terror, and I told myself; “this is my end.” I closed the eyes. Wait. Nothing was happening, so I decided to open them. That being extended his hand in a friendly manner and said: join me and do justice.

item.title: The Pharox Paradox
item.description: The Pharox Paradox © Joel Aguilozi, 2020 Sometimes when we are not satisfied with our lives, with what we do, we mistakenly wish for changes that did not occur, and we ask ourselves, What if I had done this? What would my life be like? If I had finished university? Or would I have made more money? Paradoxes exist, many of us ignore them, and for some they can become a more than disastrous reality.

item.title: Five Thousand Days and One Night
About me
item.description: I’m Joel Aguilozi, a Science Fiction writer eager to expand my horizons and venture into the world of production and artistic direction. As a passionate art enthusiast, I have worked as a chronicler and photographer at music concerts, and I am very dedicated to video games as a fan, gamer, tester, and analyst. I have always enjoyed creating things, and to my writing production, I add experiences in programming and 3D design.
